sections.heading: Making Data Speak
sections.content: S4 Statistics is about turning raw lists of numbers into useful diagrams. We focus on two specific types: the Stem-and-Leaf (for small data) and the Histogram (for grouped continuous data).

sections.heading: 1. Stem-and-Leaf Diagrams
sections.content: This diagram splits numbers into a 'Stem' (first digits) and a 'Leaf' (last digit). It preserves the original data while ordering it.

sections.heading: 2. Histograms (Advanced)
sections.content: Unlike a bar chart, the height of a histogram bar is NOT the frequency. The Area of the bar is the frequency. The height is called Frequency Density.
